dataIdInfo.idAbs: Creates a raster that identifies the peaks, which are areas of local maximum elevation, and optionally outputs the points representing these peaks.

Consts.useLimit: The are no access and use limits for this item.

tool.name: Peak
tool.summary: Creates a raster that identifies the peaks, which are areas of local maximum elevation, and optionally outputs the points representing these peaks.

scriptExample.title: Peak tool example 1 (Python window)
scriptExample.para: This example identifies the peaks in an Esri Grid raster and outputs them to a file geodatabase raster, as well as their point locations.
scriptExample.code: import arcpy from arcpy.env import env env.workspace = "C:/sapyexamples/data" arcpy.AddToolbox(r"C:\pythontoolbox\Spatial Analyst Supplemental Tools.pyt") arcpt.Peak_sas("elevation", "C:/sapyexamples/output/fgdb.gdb/peakraster", "C:/sapyexamples/output/fgdb.gdb/peakpoints"

scriptExample.title: Peak tool example 2 (stand-alone script)
scriptExample.para: This example identifies the peaks in an Esri Grid raster and outputs them to a file geodatabase raster, as well as their point locations.
scriptExample.code:
# Name: Peaktool_Ex_02.py # Description: Creats peak raster a points from raster surface # Requierments: Spatial Analyst Extension
# Import system modules import arcpy from arcpy import env
# Set environment settings env.workspace = "C:/sapyexamples/data"
# Set local variables inRaster = "elevation" outPeakRaster = "C:/sapyexamples/output/fgdb.gdb/peakraster02" outPeakPoints = "C:/sapyexamples/output/fgdb.gdb/peakpoint02"
# Check out the ArcGIS Spatial Analyst license arcpy.CheckOutExtension("Spatial") arcpy.AddToolbox(r"C:\pythontoolbox\Spatial Analyst Supplemental Tools.pyt")
# Execute Peak arcpy.Peak_sas(inRaster, outPeakRaster, outPeakPoints)

tool.usage:
• This tool requires a Spatial Analyst license.

  • A peak is a particular cell, or set of connected cells, where all surrounding cells have a lower value.

  • The output raster from the Peak tool contains the cell value of the input raster at the peak's location.

  • An optional output is a point feature class that identifies the locations of the peaks as points. The attribute table contains a field called "grid_code" which records the integer value of the input raster at those locations. When a peak is composed of several adjacent cells still only one point, inside the peak area, is returned.

  • The following environment setting affect this tool:

    • General: Current Workspace, Scratch Workspace, Output Coordinate system, Output Extent, Snap Raster.

    • Raster Analysis: Cell size, Mask
